orig_text:
EQUAL, HCOLON, SEMI, name-addr, addr-spec, and generic-param are
defined in RFC 3261 [2].
correct_text:
EQUAL, HCOLON, SEMI, name-addr, addr-spec, and generic-param are
defined in RFC 3261 [2].

If the URI contains a comma, question mark or semicolon, the URI MUST
be enclosed in angle brackets (< and >).
notes: If addr-spec is used when there are parameters, it is ambiguous if the parameters are URI parameters or served-user-param.  For consistency with RFC 3261 section 20, the same bracket rule is indicated even if comma and question mark do not cause an issue.
The ABNF as written does not take into account that concatenation binds tighter than alternation.
